perturbation.original_text: As of the VNBJ Closing, except as expressly set forth in this Amendment, the JV Agreement shall immediately cease to have any application or effect with respect to VNBJ, all rights and obligations with respect to VNBJ under the JV Agreement shall terminate and all references to “Company” or “Companies” in the JV Agreement (either in the body of the JV Agreement or its schedules and other attachments) shall read and be interpreted to mean VNBZ and/or ANRA except as the context otherwise requires.
perturbation.changed_text: As of the VNBJ Closing, except as expressly set forth in this Amendment, the JV Agreement shall immediately cease to have any application or effect with respect to VNBJ, all rights and obligations with respect to VNBJ under the JV Agreement shall terminate and all references to “the Business” or “Businesses” in the JV Agreement (either in the body of the JV Agreement or its schedules and other attachments) shall read and be interpreted to mean VNBZ and/or ANRA except as the context otherwise requires.
perturbation.explanation: The original text refers to 'Company' or 'Companies', which are generally understood to refer to the joint venture entities. The modified text replaces 'Company' with 'the Business', creating confusion whether it refers to the operational aspects of the joint venture rather than the entities themselves. This misinterpretation could create disputes over which clauses apply to ongoing business activities versus the legal entities.

perturbation.original_text: Notwithstanding Article 1.1, Article 1.2 and Article 1.3 above, the termination of the JV Agreement with respect to VNBJ, VNBZ or the Veoneer Parties shall not release any Veoneer Party or any Nissin Party from liability for the breach of any of its representations, warranties, covenants or agreements set forth in the JV Agreement that arise prior to the VNBJ Closing or the VNBZ Closing, as applicable.
perturbation.changed_text: Notwithstanding Article 1.1, Article 1.2 and Article 1.3 above, the termination of the JV Agreement with respect to VNBJ, VNBZ or the Veoneer Parties shall not release any Veoneer Entity or any Nissin Entity from liability for the breach of any of its representations, warranties, covenants or promises set forth in the JV Agreement that arise prior to the VNBJ Closing or the VNBZ Closing, as applicable.
perturbation.explanation: The original text uses 'Veoneer Party' and 'Nissin Party', referring to the specifically defined groups of companies. The modified text replaces 'Party' with 'Entity' and 'agreements' with 'promises', which are vaguer terms. 'Entity' could be interpreted more broadly than 'Party', potentially including subsidiaries or affiliates not originally intended to be bound. Similarly, 'promises' lack the legally binding force of 'agreements' which can change the enforceability of clauses.

perturbation.original_text: Notwithstanding Article 1.1, Article 1.2 and Article 1.3 above, the Nissin Parties agree to cause each of VNBJ and VNBZ to comply with Sections 4.3.2 and 4.3.3 of the JV Agreement with respect to the indemnification or reimbursement, as applicable, of all Directors and Officers (except those individuals resigning pursuant to Section 6.2.6 of the VNBJ SPA and Section 6.2.6 of the VNBZ SPA) with respect to any Liabilities arising prior to the VNBJ Closing or the VNBZ Closing, as applicable.
perturbation.changed_text: Notwithstanding Article 1.1, Article 1.2 and Article 1.3 above, the Nissin Companies agree to cause each of VNBJ and VNBZ to comply with Sections 4.3.2 and 4.3.3 of the JV Agreement with respect to the compensation or payment, as applicable, of all Executives and Managers (except those individuals resigning pursuant to Section 6.2.6 of the VNBJ SPA and Section 6.2.6 of the VNBZ SPA) with respect to any Debts arising prior to the VNBJ Closing or the VNBZ Closing, as applicable.
perturbation.explanation: Here, 'Nissin Parties' is changed to 'Nissin Companies', 'indemnification or reimbursement' to 'compensation or payment', 'Directors and Officers' to 'Executives and Managers', and 'Liabilities' to 'Debts.' These terms are not clearly defined in place of those which are, and can be interpreted as narrower terms; 'Debts' are more specific than general 'Liabilities', and 'Executives and Managers' may not encompass all 'Directors and Officers', leading to conflict on who is covered.
